WRITING.TITLE: [I Ate] Ebi Fry With Spicy Sauce

WRITING.TEXT:
Well in Sweden for example we call this a burger. For international standards this is a basic replica of burger kings crispy chicken (in Sweden).
But i do agree with you though, with the toppings and dressing it's more a sandwich but the buns are still "burger buns" (:

I will try to post a more through breakdown but the short version is
Wet batter: 1 dl all purpose flour 1 tsp baking soda 0,5 dl beer 2 spoons of corn starch or potatoe starch Salt Pepper Cayenne pepper Garlic powder Paprika powder
Try maybe less and more of the wet and flour ingredients. I want my wet better to be wet but still so solid so when I dip the chicken down and bring it up it doesn't drip until maybe 1,5-2 seconds.
Dry batter: Panko bread Salt Pepper Cayenne Paprika powder
Get it really dry on the outside, so after the wet better lift it up directly on to the plate with the dry batter and roll it really good so the whole surface is completely filled of the panko and dry!
Hope this gave you a little insight! And adjust the ration depending on how many burgers or fried chicken your making!
That sounds great! Definitely gonna try it out (;
Hehe countless tries indeed! All about the batter :)

WRITING.TITLE: [Homemade] Crispy Fried Chicken Burger with Fries and Blue cheese dip

WRITING.TEXT: Worst part is that i have one size larger, but learning gradually. I have a couple of "planks" as well i use for plating. Will try to fit i better next time ;)

The scale might fool you but without too much force this juicy piece fits perfectly in my mouth (might have a large one). There is no extra in the burger, only the ketchup, mustard and onion then 2x 110 gram beef burgers. The bun i brioche so it's very airy So uncompressed the burger is around 8-9 cm and compressed around 6-7 cm.
No fork and knife needed.
On the classic part i maybe should have written "classic double cheeseburger" ;)
Indeed! Learn from the critics ;)
Well i can assure you that it didn't burn, just the perfect maillard reaction! ;)
Actually no, I made a chili ranch dip to go with my garlic a parsley fries (:
Made a new one yesterday, this time with a better cheddar as cheese! Can you ever get enough of a good cheeseburger though? ;)

Hehe not really! Maybe it doesn't show to good but I've made a oil that I added garlic, parsley, salt pepper that I let set for 30 min. I put a spoon full on top of the fries, sadly only the parsley seem to show good.
Amen!
Well good sir! I think you would have managed the cheese overdoze, if not you would have gone to cheese heaven!

The Swedish way, there is no meal, if there is no sauce.. in epic proportions

Hehe ofc man! Klart jag r en svensk!
Fuck ramsay! But love him at the same time

Where did all you Norwegians come from haha? Jealous i see, we got butter you got oil!
That's sound perfect, come to Sweden and bring the beer and the coffee and i'll make the rest ;)
Haha well i hope that i does, IKEA's food is so basic and simple, but still the biggest Swedish brand so maybe i shouldn't complain ;)
Indeed good sir!
Well yes I might look like it or if you like it very crunchy. I cooked these in boiling water first which make the fat more tender.
Well then we're the same good sire ;) it's always about the flavor!
Haha, i've made post about the waffles recipe somewhere around the comments!
Eller briljans? Vem vet inte du, vem vet inte jag?!

The plates diameter is 1,23 meter...
No but I ate more afterwards ;)
Almost yes! (:
Bacon fat and small parts of the bacon meat :) always slow cook it for best result, but when I cook in the span with the bacon fat it gets a little bit "stained" so to speak
Norwegians, the little brother of Sweden.. all Norwegians know that the swedes.. made the waffle famous in the north.. all about Scandinavia! .. ;)
Then she does good son!

It's very similar to the American ones.
100g butter (melted) 80-100g wheat flour (get it batter like) 1/2 tsp of salt 1,5 tsp of baking powder 300g of fat milk
Mix it all, lastly the butter
Then if you can get your hands on a Swedish waffle iron (danish, Norwegian, Swedish same same)
Varsgod ;)
I'VE FAILED THE VFFLA :*(
Indeed, i usually don't make it like that but when i do i try to slowcook it with a dash of water. The brown parts are from the meat of the bacon that got stuck in the pan.
Hehe, frmodligen inte, only for the brave
Well it takes one to know one! The eggs with som mayo sriracha and cilantro on top. Great with the bacon! It was more for the "full breakfast" i added that.
Indeed, full waffles is when the hearts are combined fully around, and you could probably fit 3-4 with toppings
The plating was more for the foto, i ate maybe three times the amount of waffles (after the photoshoot)
Basically the batter and the toppings, made in the heart shaped iron. I would say that the most Swedish dish is Swedish pancakes with jam and whipped cream, and this is the waffle version
Well it's a waffle iron, and all Scandinavian countries you can find these as the basic ones. Therefore the Swedish touch to this. And of course the whipped cream and raspberry jam (;
In the butt?

Well your opinion is.. kinda Norwegians'ish so doesn't count! ;)
No but I agree, but in my family we've been making waffles with "sylt o grdde" since forever! And the bacon and egg is just a universal breakfast standard.
Well I feel part danish actually, born in the southern parts in Skne and this is how My grandma, mother and me have made our waffles, egg and bacon since the beginning of udrassil!
Yea they got a bit of the brownish hint, it's because I fried it in the bacon fat and some small parts of the bacon meat stuck!
A triad G0oODness!
Det var magi i munnen!
Well thank you, all the creds to my camera and the good lighting the sun provides!

Det r aldrig frsent att prova! Gillar man som jag att ha huvudrtt och efterrtt p en middag s blir detta rtt naturligt som frukost. Lite av varje! Framfrallt att alltid kunna avsluta med grdde och sylt!
Definitivt! Men en tugga av vfflan och en liten bit bacon r stundvis en magisk kombination. Lite vulgrt men vrt att prova ;)
Riktigt mumsigt vill jag lova!
Well! Combined all together not a hit, though bacon and waffles, bacon and eggs, in other words the bacon ties it together smooth.
Well, i took a couple and the other ones with less depth of field was a bit out of focus. Will decrease a bit till next time.. maybe a bit to artsy ;)
Indeed!
It's quite basic, instead of classic yoghurt i use Crme frache with garlic, cayenne pepper, black pepper, salt, paprika powder and Tabasco
It was very tasteful indeed! The squeeze of lemon on top made It succulent and fresh ;)

Looks like a dressed up, well trained, smooth McDonald cheeseburger.. Bet it tasted pretty damn good!
Beautiful buns! Gonna try the recipe asap!
Looks beyond delicious!
The crunch of the crisp look amazing!

Hope you ate them.. bottoms up!
